name: Toprak Dağ Şamanı
desc:
A wizened, mumbling hilichurl, one that listens to the strength of Geo.
Hilichurls especially gifted in commanding the elements who often reach the zenith of their skill in their twilight years. To the persevering mountains, these old hilichurls are but children, but their memories and experiences have guided them towards gaining power over rock and stone.

value.text: Uses Geo attributes to form a solid stone pillar to separate itself from harm. The stone pillar can be destroyed with heavy <color=#ffe14b>Geo attacks</color> , <color=#ffe14b>Claymore attacks</color> , or strong <color=#ffe14b>explosions</color> . If you can defeat it swiftly, its magical power will also vanish.

dropMaterial.name: Kehanet Parşömeni
dropMaterial.desc: A scroll that likely relates to some kind of magic. Exudes an inexplicable but ominous warmth.

dropMaterial.name: Mühürlü Parşömen
dropMaterial.desc: An old scroll lacking in detail and clarity. By following the images on it, some magical creatures can recreate a small part of its magic.

dropMaterial.name: Lanetli Parşömen
dropMaterial.desc: A scroll inscribed with ancient images. It is said that few can decipher its meaning, and the few scholars that have all went mad.

dropMaterial.name: Kırık Maske
dropMaterial.desc:
A broken bone mask that once belonged to some hilichurl.
Now more broken than complete, it can no longer perform its primary function.

dropMaterial.name: Lekeli Maske
dropMaterial.desc:
A bone mask, covered in unidentifiable stains, that emanates a mysterious odor.
Yet such is the devotion of hilichurls to masks that they will wear it nonetheless.

dropMaterial.name: Uğursuz Maske
dropMaterial.desc:
A glossy bone mask with oil markings painted on it, meant to intimidate enemies.
No one really knows why hilichurls are so fascinated with masks. Some say that it's because they don't want to see their own reflections in the water.
